…and without concrete success criteria, who is "successful" is entirely the whim of bosses, and with no way to dispute— by design. #talkpay

It’s almost noon in Wellington, NZ on International Workers’ Day, so I would like to say some things before we #talkpay
This is inherently a defiant act, for the past 40 years, in the US, wages have remained stagnant by dismantling worker protections. #talkpay
There is a risk involved in talking about salary, particularly in what are known as “Right to Work” states. http://t.co/ZfYh0EMU0R #talkpay
In these states, an employer can fire you for ANY reason, whatsoever. This is one major case of workers’ rights erosion. #talkpay
Collective action provides protection via popular opinion. There is a strength in numbers. The more of us who #talkpay the better.
That said, by participating there will be a risk involved. Another aspect of collective action is the willingness to help. #talkpay
With that in mind, if people #talkpay and feel they are terminated for doing so, I will work to start a crowdsourced legal defense fund.
Hopefully, with enough visibility, and enough coverage, we will not need to do so. But I want that safety net to be there. #talkpay
Also, I’m hoping that we would be able to work with a labor law organization to get legal help as well, if needed. #talkpay
This is an inherently radical act. Unfortunately I can’t promise to help those internationally, but I would try to network to do so #talkpay
But with that said, I am also willing to be the first person to #talkpay as I said I would do in my article here: https://t.co/XGTvCTRHJX
I’m a Sr. Software Developer w/ 9 yrs. exp. working remotely from Pittsburgh, PA for a DC based company. I make $122k/yr #talkpay
